<td bgcolor="#ebebeb" class="menunormalcell"><a href="teaching_assessment.htm" title="Teaching and Assessments">::
<table width="98%" height="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" summary="layout table">
A range of teaching and learning methods is used within SHLN, including lectures, seminars, practical performance and coaching workshops and practical laboratory sessions.

A central theme to learning at the college is that of developing the whole person and to empower student learning. This involves developing a professional partnership between students and their lecturers where they share a mutual enthusiasm, sense of enquiry and endeavour in academic work.
Students involved in teaching children from the local primary school during an activity afternoon as part of the level 1 module Children and Physical Activity.
A range of methods are deployed to assess student work including, examinations, essays, laboratory work, presentations and project work.

Quality Management and Enhancement
<td><font face="Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">Curriculum design, Content &amp
The following key features were identified:
• high quality teaching delivered by an enthusiastic and committed staff
• the professional attachments which enable students to develop professional skills eg effective communication, time management, IT and problem solving
• the opportunity to apply knowledge and skills to practical challenges and to develop as independent learners
• the supportive environment and close knit community which is highly valued by students
• the friendly and approachable staff
• excellent employment statistics
External Examiners have said:

column2: A particular strength of the course is the focus on the application of theoretical concepts and practical issues. As a result students become particularly strong at solving problems, devising strategies or developing advice and recommendations that can be applied to a particular sporting situation, client group or population. Students appear to work with a high level of motivation&quot
The assessment methods are varied and imaginative and allow students the opportunity to show initiative and flair&quot
